intro: Hieracium urdialesianum, commonly known as the Urdialesian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rough, and hairy, while its flowers are yellow and daisy-like. It is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in disturbed or semi-arid environments.
